page.title: 06Homelife in 1945
page.content: NEWBRIDGE IN 1945 _________________ Homelife was very much better because of the lack of television,everyone would crowd around the wireless and listen to the serials that used to be on.On a Sunday afternoon the whole family used to go out for a walk.My parents, my three brothers and myself would go up to the little brook and have a picnic. Q.what games did the children play? Hop scotch,and Whip top were the favourites at the time,there weren't many toys because the factories had been converted for the war effort.There were a few pre_war bicycles and the children from mining families who had very little money would use an old steel ring or a tyre and push it along.
